function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of longitudinal elements leading to unstable research findings","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of contextual factors in research findings and recommendations","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Collaboration and convergence research may involve increased interaction and collaboration between different research groups, leading to potential transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Collaboration may lead to increased spread of contagious diseases due to close contact","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of transparency and reproducibility in research practices may lead to misinformation about disease management","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Imbalance between research coverage of severe problems and ’low-hanging fruits’ may lead to inadequate understanding of disease challenges","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to diverse perspectives and marginalized populations in scholarly research","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pressure to publish frequently and focus on short-term impact","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overreliance on highly-cited and high-volume segments of scholarship","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential bias in research focus and coverage due to the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Direct applicability of the paper may be limited due to the pandemic situation.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Enduring relevance of the considerations in the paper for energy social science and research practices.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential limited effectiveness of a single intervention in reducing virus transmission.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges in implementing optimal mitigation policies to reduce peak healthcare demand and deaths.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability in people’s response to npis","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Delay in initiating social distancing and closure of schools and universities","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relaxation of social distancing measures may lead to a resurgence of transmission and new waves of infection.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate implementation of home isolation and school closures may lead to continued transmission within households and educational institutions.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Large uncertainties around transmission of the virus and policy effectiveness","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spontaneous adoption of risk-reducing behaviors uncertain","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Evolution of measures for suppression may lead to decreased efficiency of containment","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to sustain intensive npi packages for suppression may lead to rapid transmission rebound","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of ineffective epidemic suppression due to school and university closures","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Timing of interventions for mitigation and suppression strategies","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Delay in seeing the impact of interventions on hospitalised case numbers","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social and economic effects of epidemic suppression measures will be profound","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty of long-term success of epidemic suppression strategy","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assuming that each intervention has the same effect on the reproduction number across countries and over time.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on data from countries with more advanced epidemics and earlier interventions, such as italy and spain.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High level of uncertainty in estimating the effective reproduction number, rt, in italy around the time of lockdown.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Wide credible interval estimates for the reproduction number","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Non-pharmaceutical interventions vary between countries","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High 𝑅 𝑡 leading to uncontrolled epidemic","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relaxation of control measures leading to virus spread","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on reported deaths for estimating infection rates.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Strong assumption of intervention efficacy across different countries.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Timing of interventions and speed of implementation varying among countries","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited data on the impact of interventions and uncertainty in model estimates","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in initial reproduction numbers","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Large changes in rt in response to non-pharmaceutical interventions","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in reproduction numbers rt across countries","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to conclude whether interventions are sufficient to drive rt below 1","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in estimating intervention impact","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Statistical impossibility of determining the greatest effect of interventions","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability of the model without interventions to capture recent trends in deaths","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High level of under-ascertainment of infections due to focus on testing in hospital settings rather than in the community.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of data on the individual effect size of each intervention","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lag between infections and deaths","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in adherence to interventions affecting forecast of future deaths","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of certainty in the effectiveness of non-pharmaceutical interventions in countries at earlier stages of the epidemic.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"}]}
